posts.cooked:
So we have completed our YAGSL code, and overall it is functioning properly. However, we have encountered a few issues. Firstly, some offsets seem to be incorrect, causing the forward position to not align properly. The primary concern, though, is the robot’s lack of response when we flick the right joystick left or right. We suspect that this issue may be due to a missing definition for a particular method. If anyone has any ideas or suggestions, please let us know! Screenshot 2024-03-14 at 4.38.50 PM 1920×1200 201 KB https://github.com/Rafael-Lindemberg/Regionals-2024

Screenshot 2024-03-14 at 4.38.50 PM 1920×1200 201 KB

Screenshot 2024-03-14 at 4.38.50 PM 1920×1200 201 KB
That image is useless, if anyone can take a look at this GitHub and see if there are any obvious mistakes lmk GitHub - Rafael-Lindemberg/YAGSLSwerve

posts.name: Isaac
posts.cooked:
The drive method you are using is driveFieldOrientedDirectAngle (line 64; 86), and in the comment, it specifies (line 63):

right stick controls the desired angle NOT angular rotation

Right stick goes from -1 to 1. In theory, your robot should just be going from -1 degree to 1 degree. (not the desired outcome)

Maybe multiply the number by 180, or use some other drive commands like driveFieldOrientedAnglularVelocity that you already have initialized.

posts.name: Gavin Matthews
posts.cooked:
isaacngkh:

Right stick goes from -1 to 1. In theory, your robot should just be going from -1 degree to 1 degree. (not the desired outcome)

I think the intention of the code here is to use both the X and Y on the right stick to control the angle.  See getTargetSpeeds .

Looking in controllerproperties.json , I see that that angleJoystickRadiusDeadband=0.5 which seems high.

I’m not sure where you’re setting attainableMaxRotationalVelocityRadiansPerSecond .  You might want to print that out to make sure it’s non-zero.
Where would I declare attainableMaxRotationalVelocityRadiansPerSecond . And we don’t want to use x and y only x for rotation. The headband can be changed later.
That variable isn’t used unless you use SwerveDrive.setModuleSpeeds
